article.headline: Coastal Carolina 72, The Citadel 64
article.story: CONWAY, S.C. -- Chad Gray scored 27 points and Desmond Holloway had a double-double to lead Coastal Carolina over The Citadel 72-64 on Saturday night. The Chanticleers (6-2) trailed 33-28 at halftime before shooting 57.1 percent (16 of 28) and going 11 for 13 from the free-throw line (84.6 percent) in the second half in their fourth straight win. Coastal Carolina trailed 51-45 with 9:49 remaining and Holloway scored six straight to tie it. The Chanticleers then took their first lead since midway through the first half, 59-58, on Holloway's free throws with 5:19 left. The Bulldogs' Matt Clark made two free throws to cut the deficit to 66-64 with 49 seconds left, but the Chanticleers scored six straight and The Citadel missed three 3-pointers the rest of the way. Holloway finished with 18 points and 11 rebounds. Clark had 18 points and Cameron Wells 22 for The Citadel (1-4).

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
